pr_title: HDDS-3668. OzoneManager start fails with RocksDB error on downgrade to older version.

timeline.message: HDDS-3668. OzoneManager start fails with RocksDB error on downgrade to older version.

timeline.body:
One question, can these extra column families can be dropped, if they are not required after upgrade/downgrade.

Because now we removed S3Table in #940. So, once after upgrade, technically we don't require the column family any more.
timeline.bodyText:
One question, can these extra column families can be dropped, if they are not required after upgrade/downgrade.
Because now we removed S3Table in #940. So, once after upgrade, technically we don't require the column family any more.
timeline.bodyHTML:
One question, can these extra column families can be dropped, if they are not required after upgrade/downgrade.

Because now we removed S3Table in #940. So, once after upgrade, technically we don't require the column family any more.
timeline.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: @bharatviswa504 That is a good point. Based on our offline discussion, this will be handled on a case-by-case basis as outlined in the Ozone upgrades design doc (HDDS-3698).
replies.author: avijayanhwx

timeline.body: Can this comment be more clear saying ColumnFamily in DB, but not in the current version something like that?
timeline.bodyText: Can this comment be more clear saying ColumnFamily in DB, but not in the current version something like that?
timeline.bodyHTML: Can this comment be more clear saying ColumnFamily in DB, but not in the current version something like that?
timeline.author: bharatviswa504

timeline.body: Question: If column family is missing also, but DBStore will open that column family right currently? So, do we need to check the columnFamily is opened or not also?
timeline.bodyText: Question: If column family is missing also, but DBStore will open that column family right currently? So, do we need to check the columnFamily is opened or not also?
timeline.bodyHTML: Question: If column family is missing also, but DBStore will open that column family right currently? So, do we need to check the columnFamily is opened or not also?
timeline.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: Added check for the extra column family.
replies.author: avijayanhwx

timeline.body:
Nit: `extraCf` cannot be null, so I would prefer not adding a dependency:

```suggestion
      if (!extraCf.isEmpty()) {
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Nit: extraCf cannot be null, so I would prefer not adding a dependency:

Suggested change
if (CollectionUtils.isNotEmpty(extraCf)) {
if (!extraCf.isEmpty()) {
timeline.author: adoroszlai

timeline.body:
Nit: I think `List.toString` is just as good:

```suggestion
                "{}", extraCf);
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Nit: I think List.toString is just as good:

Suggested change
"{}", Arrays.toString(extraCf.toArray()));
"{}", extraCf);
timeline.author: adoroszlai

```suggestion
          columnFamiliesInDb);
```
timeline.bodyHTML:

columnFamiliesInDb);

timeline.author: adoroszlai
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -149,6 +162,26 @@ public RDBStore(File dbFile, DBOptions options,
     }
   }
 
+  /**
+   * Read DB and return existing column families.
+   * @return List of column families
+   * @throws RocksDBException on Error.
+   */
+  private List<TableConfig> getColumnFamiliesInExistingDb()
+      throws RocksDBException {
+    List<byte[]> bytes = RocksDB.listColumnFamilies(new Options(),
+        dbLocation.getAbsolutePath());
+    List<TableConfig> columnFamiliesInDb = bytes.stream()
+        .map(cfbytes -> new TableConfig(StringUtils.bytes2String(cfbytes),
+            DBProfile.DISK.getColumnFamilyOptions()))
